title: Manchin Reiterates Concerns About Democrats' Social-Spending, Climate Bill
sub_head: West Virginia senator urges immediate vote on parallel infrastructure package
body:
WASHINGTON—Sen. Joe Manchin (D., W.Va.) issued criticism of Democrats’ $1.85 trillion social and climate spending effort, withholding his support for a legislative framework that the White House had cast as a consensus acceptable to all 50 members of the Senate Democratic caucus.
“I’m open to supporting a final bill that helps move our country forward. But I’m equally open to voting against a bill that hurts our country,” he said at an afternoon press conference.
